body.name: ARCTIC P12 Slim PWM PST - 120 mm Case Fan with PWM Sharing Technology (PST), Pressure-optimised, Quiet Motor, Computer, Extra Slim, 300-2100 RPM - Black

features: OPTIMISED FOR STATIC PRESSURE: Through high static pressure, the fan guarantees efficient cooling, even with increased air resistance. Suitable for use on heat sinks and radiators
STRONG COOLING PERFORMANCE: The performance of the P fans has been noticeably increased through numerous improvements, including upgraded engine technology and a newly developed fan design
300 TO 2100 RPM: Thanks to the 4-pin connector, the fan speed can be controlled via PWM PST. This keeps noise to a minimum while at the same time ensuring maximum cooling performance
LOW INSTALLATION HEIGHT: The P12 Slim PWM PST has an installation height of only 15 mm, making it suitable for small form factor cases & for installations for which a 25 mm fan does not fit
TECHNICAL DATA: Fan speed: 300–2100 RPM, Airflow: 71.53 m³/h/41.1 CFM, Noise Level: 0.3 Sone, Static Pressure: 1.45 mm/H2O, Pin: 4-pin
body.description: General data Performance Fan Speed: 300–2100 rpm Airflow: 42.1 CFM/71.53 m³/h Static Pressure: 1.45 mm H₂O Noise Level: 0.3 Sone Fan Fan Frame: Standard RPM-Control: PWM PST Connector: 4-Pin-Connector + 4-Pin-Socket Fan Bearing: Fluid Dynamic Bearing Operating Ambient Temperature: 0 - 40 °C Electric Characteristics Typical Voltage: 12 V DC Startup Voltage: 5 V Current/Voltage: 0.12 A | 12 V Cable Length: 400 mm

manufacturerProductDescription.media_text: Ideal for small spaces Unlike standard 120 mm case fans with a thickness of 25 mm, the P12 Slim PWM PST has a mounting depth of only 15 mm. This makes it the ideal choice for Small Form Factor (SFF) builds. Corresponding screws for mounting on a radiator are already included.

Ideal for small spaces Unlike standard 120 mm case fans with a thickness of 25 mm, the P12 Slim PWM PST has a mounting depth of only 15 mm. This makes it the ideal choice for Small Form Factor (SFF) builds. Corresponding screws for mounting on a radiator are already included.

Optimised for high static pressure Because the fan design of the P12 Slim PWM PST is optimised for focused airflow, it generates high static pressure. The fan enables extremely efficient cooling and good airflow— even with increased air resistance. This makes the P12 Slim PWM PST particularly well-suited for use on concealed case intakes, dust filters, radiators, and generally in small cases that have little space for free airflow due to compactly placed hardware. Maximum quietness, minimum vibration The operating noise of the newly-developed ARCTIC motor is barely perceptible, even at the lowest speed. Thanks to its special magnetization, the motor of the P-fans generates no start-up jerks and only a fraction of the commutation vibrations of a conventional DC motor. As a result, there is far less vibration on the housing at different speeds and no need for rubber buffering or additional decoupling. Improved service life The new ARCTIC motor generates significantly less frictional heat than its predecessors and current competitor models. As a result, coil temperature is reduced by up to 20 degrees, quadrupling service life, while reduced frictional losses ensure more efficient operation.

300 to 2100 rpm controlled via PWM PST With a wide speed range and innovative PWM Sharing Technology (PST), the P12 Slim PWM PST's fan speed can be controlled in sync with other fans. ARCTIC's PST fans come equipped with their own built-in daisy-chain solution, and, in addition to the plug-in connector, have another socket to which an additional fan or up to 4 other PST fans can be connected in series. High quality sleeve bearing Thanks to a combination of alloy and lubricant developed in Germany, friction within the bearing is minimized and greater efficiency is achieved. In addition to preventing lubricant loss, wear on the pin and sleeve is also reduced to a minimum. Less heat is developed, less bearing noise is generated and the life of the fan is extended significantly. 0dB mode - Zero rpm The speed of the P12 Slim PWM PST can be throttled down to a standstill via PWM. This allows efficient and silent PC operation in idle while guaranteeing maximum performance on demand.

General data Performance Fan Speed: 300–2100 rpm Airflow: 42.1 CFM/71.53 m³/h Static Pressure: 1.45 mm H₂O Noise Level: 0.3 Sone Fan Fan Frame: Standard RPM-Control: PWM PST Connector: 4-Pin-Connector + 4-Pin-Socket Fan Bearing: Fluid Dynamic Bearing Operating Ambient Temperature: 0 - 40 °C Electric Characteristics Typical Voltage: 12 V DC Startup Voltage: 5 V Current/Voltage: 0.12 A | 12 V Cable Length: 400 mm Size & Weight Length: 120 mm Width: 120 mm Height: 15 mm Weight: 85 g

reviews.reviewDate: Reviewed in the United States on January 10, 2024
reviews.reviewTitle: 5.0 out of 5 stars Great thin fan
reviews.reviewText: Quiet, no weird/annoying noises, surprisingly thin, price is great. The only complaint that I have is that they didn't include 4 x M4 nuts, I do get that it's mostly a problem of custom builds, but it could help.

reviews.reviewDate: Reviewed in the United States on May 10, 2021
reviews.reviewTitle: 5.0 out of 5 stars Perfect for Meshify C owners!
reviews.reviewText: Let me get this out of the way first... If you have a Meshify C, this will fit the gap behind the front mesh WITHOUT modification. This makes it a perfect candidate for Meshify C owners who have long GPUs, an AIO cooler, and want a push/pull configuration (yes, all three of us).I have a Meshify C and an EVGA RTX 2080 Super FTW3 Hybrid (with 240mm AIO mod), which is a very long card. Having a 360mm AIO in the front meant I couldn't fit a standard 25mm wide fan in the middle of the radiator as it would not have enough clearance. These fans fixed that issue, leaving about 8mm of clearance between the fan and GPU. In addition to this, I was able to mount these as a push configuration RIGHT behind the front mesh. They don't interfere with the front mesh closing and require zero modification.If you want to get an idea of this modification, search for "O_DXoIhMdj0" on YouTube and it will take you to "Another EPIC Build Montage" by BtiWit. Skip to 4:55 to see how the standard 25mm fan is mounted externally and then at 5:46 to see how the front mesh is modified to fit the larger fans. With these fans, you will NOT need to do this modification. These fans fit here without any problems!If you want to mount these to a radiator, head on down to your local hardware store and get #6-32 x 7/8 screws and some washers. My local Home Depot only had 3/4" (too short) and 1" (too long), so I went with 1" and put three washers on each screw so they don't interfere with my radiator fins.Extremely happy with the results. I get push/pull, low temps, and a very quiet build.

reviews.reviewDate: Reviewed in the United States on December 18, 2023
reviews.reviewText: These worked great for my setup. Have an aio and a 3080 and couldnt fit a normal size 25mm thick fan in my case. The fans are quiet and push a decent amount of air. All you can hear is moving air and not the fan motor which is great.

reviews.reviewDate: Reviewed in the United States on November 22, 2023
reviews.reviewTitle: 4.0 out of 5 stars Great Slim fans that do their job!
reviews.reviewText: Great fans for specifically anyone with a small formfactor pc case. The noise levels are very good. The slimness of the fans is great as well making it easy to install in almost any case.I did have one issue with one of the 4 fans I ordered, one has started making a clicking sound so I have to turn it off since it drives me crazy.Other than that worth every penny! Highly Recommend

reviews.reviewDate: Reviewed in the United States on January 5, 2024
reviews.reviewText: They worked so well I bought two more sets to replace the fans in my other builds. Not only were they quiet but being able the daisy chain them without another adapter allowed me to clean up some cable management

reviews.reviewDate: Reviewed in the United States on February 5, 2024
reviews.reviewTitle: 5.0 out of 5 stars Great price and quality for slim 120mm case fans
reviews.reviewText: The fans have been working great! The slim profile makes a huge difference especially in smaller cases. Very impressed by these and will be buying more in the near future.

reviews.reviewDate: Reviewed in the United States on January 18, 2024
reviews.reviewTitle: 5.0 out of 5 stars Pushes good air and small!
reviews.reviewText: If you are looking for a great budget fan competing in specs with Noctua's 15mm fans, get this fan, and you won't regret it. I would feel comfortable putting these on a radiator for a small form factor build. They are also quiet!

reviews.reviewDate: Reviewed in the United States on October 14, 2023
reviews.reviewTitle: 5.0 out of 5 stars Great slim profile fan
reviews.reviewText: This fan is much slimmer than normal case fans which comes in handy if you are tight on space. I bought this to put on the other side of my hybrid cooler radiator and it works great. The extra fan connection coming off this makes it great for if you are adding a second fan to a radiator so that you can have both fans run off one connection. Fan is audible at max speed but isn’t bad at all especially if you have other audio playing or if you are wearing a headset you probably won’t hear it.

En muchas ocasiones las personas ahorran mucho tiempo para comprar su PC (yo siempre recomiendo a mis clientes gastar más en GPU y CPU) por lo que muchas veces terminan comprando gabinetes pequeños sin salida de aire... pero créeme que estos ventiladores son UNA JOYA para solucionar eso.TAMAÑO:Para empezar es un pack de 3 y al ser SLIM (marco más delgado que el normal) va a entrar en casi cualquier gabinete... yo los instalé en mi 2da PC destinada al stream, es un gabinetes Yeyian Haizen 2500, el cual ya trae 3 ventiladores pre instalados (nada malos por cierto) te darás cuenta que hice un mix, puse un artic atrás, uno arriba y al frente los cambié por un yeyian para ese ponerlo arriba. Entonces por espacio no te preocupas.CONECTIVIDAD: NO NECESITAS CONTROLADOR... en el nombre si pones atención dice "PST" (PWM Sharing Technology) significa que todos se pueden conectar en cadena (Daisy chain) a un solo puerto de tu motherboard. Cada ventilador tiene un cable con una conexión en "Y", esto es para que la primera cabeza vaya a algún puerto "CHA_FAN" de tu motherboard y a la otra le conectas otro ventilador y así sucesivamente como te lo pongo en la imagen. La verdad que esto esto se los recomiendo a mis clientes con motherboards con pocos puertos "CHA_FAN" porque solo te toma un puerto para conectar 3 ventiladores.Consejo: es mejor conectar todo directo a la motherboard para controlar las rpm o su curva de ventilación desde la BIOS y así optimizas recursos para no abrir más programas.CONTROL:Pero si no le sabes a la BIOS puedes visitar mi canal de youtube "El Macmado" o cualquier red social con mi nombre y preguntarme por mensaje.O dependiendo de tu motherboard tendrás un programa para controlarlos, la mía que es ASUS usa el "Ai Suite 3" solo entras, buscas la opción de "Fan Xpert2+" y le das en "Ajuste de ventiladores" para que te los reconozca y te haga una prueba (como la de pantalla) cuando termine ya puedes poner rpm's fijas o hacer tus curvas de ventilaciones personalizadas.RUIDO:El ruido que haces es increíblemente bajo, hace más ruido el ventilador del procesador (porque gira a más de 3000rpm y los artic máximo a 2050) por lo que puedes hacer la prueba para que te des una idea del ruido. Además tienes un muy buen flujo de aire y presión estática por lo que avientan bastante aire de frente y mueven bastante aire.TEMPERATURAS:Antes tenía mi gabinete sin panel y mi CPU (i5 11400F) iba a 60 grados y mi GPU (EVGA 1660 ti) a 45 sin hacer nada.Con estos ventiladores y panel cerrado voy a 48 en el CPU y 32 en la GPU.Te dejo una imagen para mostrarte todos los programas, la carga y las temps de mi PC de streams.CPU a máximo 65 grados y GPU a 43 máximo, con toda la carga de mis programas.Los programas que uso son:- OBS Studio (con previsualización normal para twitch y vertical para TikTok).- Streamerbot- Discord- Lumiastream- GoXLR Utility- Spotify o TIDAL- Songify (para que añadan canciones mis espectadores- Snap Camera- MSI afterburner- entre otrasEntonces resumiendo... ¿Valen la pena?SIN DUDA ALGUNA, los he puesto en 4 pcs y en todas me redujeron bastante las temperaturas.Si tienes duda mándame mensaje a cualquiera de mis redes: Elmacmado.Saludos

These fans saved my new computer build! I underestimated the size of my new graphics card when I was installing it in my case, I did not have any room for the normal size fans and so I bought these.They were very easy to install and because there is a daisy chain connector I can make my cable management very clean. They are very quiet in-comparison to the Corsair fans that I used previously in a different build. I would definitely buy these again if I were trying to attempt an ITX Build sometime in the future.

Do the job, not a performance from slim fans. A good product for the money. 3x fans for the price of one Noctua, for me sound like a good deal as long you run out of space and money because of the ridiculous new nvidia video cards size and price. In the past I always used premium fans from Noctua and Corsair, but right now I decided to go with low cost and as far I do not notice any difference. The time will tell how long will last.

reviews.reviewTitle: Artic no me decepciona, solo que no me sirvio
reviews.reviewText: tengo el liquid freezer 2 240, compre estos para poder poner el radiador en la parte de arriba del case, ya que con los originales pegaba en las memorias, pero igual no funciono, sigue pegando por unos cuantos milimetros, el case es un XPG invader, mobo b450 aorus m, ram fury renegade sin rgb

Se hai un case ITX e gli ingombri sono quelli che sono queste sono ventole che danno una grossa mano! Comprate due pack da sei ventole in totale.Due sotto la gpu (ci vanno al pelo in un case fractal torrent nano)Una in estrazione posterioreE le altre quattro in “push-pull per un radiatore next kraken éliteUn Ryzen 7 7800x3d lo tengono in idle a 35gradi (temperatura stanza 21gradi)Mentre la gpu viaggia sui 26 (6950xtx triventola )In definitiva con 1,5cm di spazio avete delle ottime ventole ad un prezzo più che onesto
